justification: The article notes that "Early research on theory of mind in the brain often used images and vignettes as task conditions (e.g., the Sally-Anne test)."
It states that recent work studies mentalization "using strategic games such as matching pennies… as laboratory tasks."
The same sentence lists "Prisoner's dilemmas" alongside matching pennies as games employed to probe the neural mechanisms of mentalization.

topic_or_construct: Individual vs. Group utility (social value integration)
justification: The text explains that Park et al. (2019) used "a group decision-making task (a public goods game)" to dissociate neural encoding of individual rewards and group utility.

It reports that "In the ultimatum game, inhibitory TMS administered to the TPJ changes the counterfactual evaluation of the offer," indicating the game is the instrument for measuring that evaluative construct.
